display.name: Region
display.entityAnnotationsMap: Western offshoots (MPD): United States, Canada, Australia and New Zealand

presentation.titlePublic: World regions according to Maddison Project Database

descriptionKey: The Maddison Project Database is based on the work of many researchers who have produced estimates of economic growth and population for individual countries. The full list of sources for this historical data is given in [the original dataset](https://dataverse.nl/api/access/datafile/421302).

origins.title: Maddison Project Database
origins.description: The Maddison Project Database provides information on comparative economic growth and income levels over the very long run. The 2023 version of this database covers 169 countries and the period up to 2022. The new estimates are presented and discussed in Bolt and Van Zanden (2024), "Maddison style estimates of the evolution of the world economy: A new 2023 update", Journal of Economic Surveys, 141.
origins.citationFull:
- Bolt, Jutta and Jan Luiten van Zanden (2024), "Maddison style estimates of the evolution of the world economy: A new 2023 update", Journal of Economic Surveys, 141. DOI: 10.1111/joes.12618.
- The Maddison Project Database is based on the work of many researchers who have produced estimates of economic growth and population for individual countries. The full list of sources for this historical data is given in [the original dataset](https://dataverse.nl/api/access/datafile/421302).
origins.attribution: Bolt and van Zanden - Maddison Project Database 2023
